metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5017 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the C cli shell in Apache Zookeeper before 3.4.9 and 3.5.x before 3.5.3, when using the "cmd:" batch mode syntax, allows attackers to have unspecified impact via a long command string. It was discovered that Apache ZooKeeper incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5017` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzookeeper-java - 3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzookeeper-mt2 - 3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzookeeper-st2 - 3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzookeeper2 - 3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-zookeeper - 3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zookeeper - 3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zookeeper-bin - 3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zookeeperd - 3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zookeeper package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.5+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
